column5: ~~~~Was heading down to Picton on sat. with buddy Slug, even had bait bought and a new float jacket, ready  to go, then took a real long look at the Weather Page, for Picton -17 in the am. with winds out of the west at 25. Yried to figer out the wind chill, and decided it was too cold. Now what do I do with 3doz.frozen minnows??????
I don't blame ya a bit!!!  Sushi? A little pressed rice jacket with dried Kelp Christmas Trees and a Pimento Santa Hat = quick and easy Holiday hor-d'oeuvres with a festive flair!
Dont blame you for not going!!!  As for the minnows....fish crisp snack?
how about go during the middle of the week? looking pretty good
If properly dressed, it can actually be alot of fun out there and one thing's for sure, there wouldn't be alot of boats out there either! I'm heading down on Thursday, weather be damned! HH
Salt 'em...use for icefishing...the head or a bit of tail works well for crappie at Uncle Jack's Lake...  Who dat masked man in da middle...???

Yep it was cold, but still nice.  I went to go out yesterday in the St. Lawrence.  Made it a bit farther than you.  I actually got away from the dock, motor running, as I shovel snow off the boat.  Get out in the river, go to make a turn.  No turn.  Crap steering froze.  Luckily I wasn't very far from home.  Dropped a line anyways and used the bow troller to get back.  With what we had here, I can see how Picton would have been nasty.  It looked like a great day for fishing, but I guess the fish thought other wise.   Good call on only wasting minnows and nothing else.  How big is your freezer?  Could always keep them till you can walk on water.
Have a feeling most launches except for the ferry launch will be frozen for the year after this week. BE CAREFUL out there guys!!!!!
